_note: Web frontend backlog. Backend backlog archived in prd-backend.json.

backlog.description: Create the web/ directory using Vite with React and TypeScript template. Configure strict TypeScript via tsconfig.json. Install core dependencies: react-router-dom, @tanstack/react-query, recharts, date-fns, lucide-react. Set up VITE_API_URL environment variable with default to http://localhost:8000/api/v1. Verify the dev server starts with npm run dev.
acceptance_criteria: web/ directory exists with Vite React TS project — verify with ls web/package.json and web/tsconfig.json
TypeScript strict mode enabled in tsconfig.json — verify by reading compilerOptions.strict = true
All core dependencies installed (react-router-dom, @tanstack/react-query, recharts, date-fns, lucide-react) — verify with npm ls in web/
VITE_API_URL env var configured with default — verify by reading web/.env or web/src/lib/api.ts
npm run dev starts Vite dev server without errors — verify by running command

backlog.description: Install and configure TailwindCSS v4 in the Vite project. Initialize shadcn/ui with 'npx shadcn@latest init' choosing New York style, zinc base color, and CSS variables. Install initial shadcn components: button, card, input, label, badge, separator, dropdown-menu, dialog, table, toast, sonner. Verify Tailwind classes render correctly.
acceptance_criteria: TailwindCSS v4 is installed and configured — verify by checking web/package.json and that utility classes render in browser
shadcn/ui initialized with components.json config — verify by reading web/components.json
All listed shadcn components installed in web/src/components/ui/ — verify with ls web/src/components/ui/
A test page with a shadcn Button renders correctly — verify by viewing in browser

backlog.feature: TypeScript API types mirroring shared crate DTOs
backlog.description: Create web/src/types/ directory with TypeScript interfaces that mirror the Rust shared crate DTOs. Define: TiltColor (string union of 8 colors), TiltReading, CreateReadingsBatch, BrewStatus ('Active' | 'Completed' | 'Archived'), CreateBrew, UpdateBrew, BrewResponse, CreateHydrometer, UpdateHydrometer, HydrometerResponse, ReadingResponse, ReadingsQuery. All field names in camelCase matching the serde serialization.
acceptance_criteria: web/src/types/index.ts exports all DTO interfaces — verify by reading file
TiltColor is a union type of 8 color strings — verify by reading type definition

BrewResponse interface has all fields matching Rust BrewResponse (id, name, style, og, fg, targetFg, abv, status, startDate, endDate, notes, hydrometerId, createdAt, updatedAt, latestReading) — verify by reading interface
HydrometerResponse interface matches Rust HydrometerResponse — verify by reading interface
ReadingResponse interface matches Rust ReadingResponse — verify by reading interface
npm run build succeeds with no TypeScript errors — verify by running command

backlog.feature: API client and TanStack Query provider setup
backlog.description: Create web/src/lib/api.ts with a typed fetch wrapper that prepends VITE_API_URL to all requests, handles JSON parsing, and throws typed errors for non-2xx responses. Create web/src/lib/query-client.ts configuring a QueryClient with sensible defaults (staleTime 30s, retry 1). Wrap the app in QueryClientProvider in main.tsx. Create web/src/hooks/use-brews.ts, use-hydrometers.ts, use-readings.ts with TanStack Query hooks for each resource's CRUD operations.
acceptance_criteria: web/src/lib/api.ts exports typed fetch functions (apiGet, apiPost, apiPut, apiDelete) — verify by reading file
API client reads VITE_API_URL from import.meta.env — verify by reading file
QueryClientProvider wraps the app in main.tsx — verify by reading file
useBrews() hook returns { data, isLoading, error } from GET /brews — verify by reading hook file
useHydrometers() hook exists with list/create/update/delete mutations — verify by reading hook file
useReadings() hook accepts query params (brewId, since, until, limit) — verify by reading hook file
npm run build succeeds — verify by running command

backlog.feature: React Router configuration with route structure
backlog.description: Set up React Router v7 in web/src/main.tsx with BrowserRouter. Create route structure: / (dashboard), /brews (brew list), /brews/:id (brew detail), /brews/new (create brew), /hydrometers (hydrometer list). Create placeholder page components in web/src/pages/ for each route. Configure a 404 catch-all route.
acceptance_criteria: BrowserRouter configured in main.tsx — verify by reading file
Routes defined for /, /brews, /brews/:id, /brews/new, /hydrometers — verify by reading router config
Placeholder page components exist in web/src/pages/ (dashboard.tsx, brew-list.tsx, brew-detail.tsx, brew-new.tsx, hydrometer-list.tsx) — verify with ls
404 catch-all route renders a not-found page — verify by reading router config
Navigation between routes works — verify by clicking links in browser

backlog.description: Create web/src/components/layout/app-shell.tsx as the root layout component. It should render a fixed sidebar on the left (collapsible on mobile) and a main content area. The sidebar contains the app logo/title ('Tilt Dashboard'), navigation links (Dashboard, Brews, Hydrometers), and a footer with version info. Use shadcn/ui components and Lucide icons (LayoutDashboard, Beer, Thermometer). The layout should use an Outlet from React Router for nested route rendering.

React Router Outlet renders child route content — verify by navigating between routes

backlog.description: Create web/src/pages/dashboard.tsx as the main landing page. Display summary cards using shadcn Card components: Active Brews count, Total Hydrometers count, Latest Reading (temperature + gravity from most recent reading across all hydrometers), and Readings Today count. Each card uses TanStack Query hooks to fetch data from the API. Show loading skeletons while data loads.

Total Hydrometers card shows count from GET /hydrometers — verify by reading source

Loading skeleton placeholders shown while queries are pending — verify by throttling network in devtools

backlog.description: Below the summary cards on the dashboard, render a section titled 'Active Brews' showing a compact list of all brews with status=Active. backlog.description: Configure the dashboard's TanStack Query hooks with a refetchInterval of 30 seconds so data updates automatically without manual refresh. Add a visual indicator (small pulsing dot or timestamp) showing when data was last refreshed. Add a manual refresh button (RefreshCw icon) that invalidates all dashboard queries immediately.

Last refreshed timestamp displayed on dashboard — verify by viewing in browser

backlog.description: Create web/src/pages/brew-new.tsx with a form for creating a new brew. Fields: Name (required text input), Style (optional text input), Hydrometer (required select dropdown populated from GET /hydrometers), OG (optional number input), Target FG (optional number input), Notes (optional textarea). backlog.feature: Brew detail page with readings summary

Below the details, show a 'Readings' section (placeholder for now — will be filled by Readings-Visualization group). backlog.feature: Edit brew dialog with inline updates
backlog.description: Create web/src/components/brew/edit-brew-dialog.tsx as a shadcn Dialog that pre-fills form fields with the current brew data. backlog.feature: Gravity and temperature line charts on brew detail
backlog.description: Create web/src/components/readings/readings-chart.tsx using Recharts. Render a dual-axis LineChart: left Y-axis for specific gravity (e.g., 1.000–1.100), right Y-axis for temperature (°F), X-axis for time (formatted with date-fns). Gravity line in blue, temperature line in orange. Accept brewId prop and fetch readings via useReadings(brewId). Support time range selection (Last 24h, Last 7d, Last 30d, All) via buttons that adjust the 'since' query param. Include tooltips showing exact values on hover. Responsive — fills container width.
acceptance_criteria: Dual-axis LineChart renders gravity (left axis) and temperature (right axis) — verify by viewing on brew detail page
X-axis shows time labels formatted appropriately for the selected range — verify by viewing chart
Tooltip on hover shows exact gravity, temperature, and timestamp — verify by hovering over data points
Time range selector buttons (24h, 7d, 30d, All) filter the displayed data — verify by clicking each and watching chart update
Chart is responsive and fills container width — verify by resizing browser

backlog.description: Create web/src/components/readings/readings-table.tsx showing readings in a shadcn Table below the chart on the brew detail page. Columns: Recorded At (formatted datetime), Temperature (°F), Gravity (SG), RSSI (if available). Sort by recorded_at DESC by default. Implement client-side pagination (25 rows per page) with Previous/Next buttons. Accept brewId prop and reuse the useReadings hook.
acceptance_criteria: Readings table renders with Recorded At, Temperature, Gravity, RSSI columns — verify by viewing on brew detail page
Rows sorted by recorded_at DESC (newest first) — verify by checking row order
Pagination shows 25 rows per page with Previous/Next controls — verify by navigating pages

Empty state shown when no readings exist — verify with a brew that has no readings

backlog.description: Create web/src/components/readings/fermentation-stats.tsx that calculates and displays fermentation metrics from the readings data. Show: Current Gravity (latest reading), Apparent Attenuation (% = (OG - current) / (OG - 1.0) * 100), Estimated ABV ((OG - current) * 131.25), Temperature Trend (arrow up/down/steady based on last 3 readings), Time Since Last Reading (formatted with date-fns formatDistanceToNow). Display as a row of stat cards above the chart on the brew detail page.
acceptance_criteria: Fermentation stats render as a row of cards above the chart — verify by viewing brew detail page
Current Gravity shows the latest reading's gravity value — verify by checking against API data
Apparent Attenuation calculated correctly from OG and current gravity — verify with known values
Estimated ABV calculated correctly — verify with known values (e.g., OG 1.050, FG 1.010 = ~5.25%)
Temperature Trend shows up/down/steady arrow — verify by checking with readings that have varying temperatures
Time Since Last Reading shows human-readable duration (e.g., '5 minutes ago') — verify by viewing
